discussion.p: The note in paragraph 2 refers to 'undefined void operators', while the section declares a pair of operators returning bool.

blockquote.p: Changed from Pending WP to Open. This issue was voted to WP at the same time the operators were changed from private to deleted. The two issues stepped on each other. What do we want the return type of these deleted functions to be?
I suggest harmonizing this issue with similar classes. E.g. in bool return values for

are used and basically all newer provided deleted copy assignment operators of type X use the canonical return type X& instead of void. Since the note mentioned in the issue description has now already been changed to
deleted overloads close possible hole in the type system
it seems to be of even lesser need to perform the change. Therefore I recommend declaring the issue as NAD.

blockquote.pre: template<class Function2> bool void operator==(const function<Function2>&); template<class Function2> bool void operator!=(const function<Function2>&);
